name: Haitian Music
description: Encompasses the styles of music developed by the Haitian people.

children.name: Cadence rampa
children.description: Developed in parallel with Compas, based on Méringue with a stronger Cuban influence.

children.name: Compas
children.description: Popular genre from Haiti, updating the older Méringue style with influences from Mambo and Jazz.

children.name: Haitian Vodou Drumming
children.description: Form of rhythmic performance by Haitian Vodou practitioners, played at associated ceremonies.

children.name: Méringue
children.description: Haitian genre that dates back to the early 19th century; the roots of Compas.

children.name: Rabòday
children.description: Fast-paced rhythm inspired by Rara, with Electronic instrumentation and humorous sexual and political lyrics.

children.name: Rara
children.description: Derived from the Haitian Vodou Drumming tradition, often played at street festivals and carnivals and usually having celebratory or political lyrics.

children.name: Rasin
children.description: Blends the highly rhythmic drumming of traditional Haitian Vodou music with Rock-influenced electric instrumentation such as guitar, keyboard, and bass.

children.name: Twoubadou
children.description: Pastoral, often satirical Haitian style usually performed by small groups centered around the acoustic guitar.
